articles.description: Australian football referee Joanna Charaktis just wanted to help her friend escape Afghanistan. What followed was a story of close calls, emotional reunions and a community rallying together to change lives, writes Samantha Lewis.
articles.content: Three words were all it took. Three simple words "are you OK?" that, like a stone dropped in a lake, created ripple effects that would change the lives of some in Afghanistan's women's football commu… [+14978 chars]

articles.author: Adrian Proszenko
articles.title: ‘Wake up to yourself’: Woman at centre of Tyrone May sex scandal breaks silence - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Just when she thought the saga was finally over, the woman at the centre of the Tyrone May sex tape scandal had to relive the entire ordeal.
articles.content:
I see my psychologist on regular occasions and I have to work through that. I had quite a lot of panic attacks, so with this coming back, it triggered that as well.
I walk around in Penrith and ever… [+3107 chars]
